alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Orange; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 3:53AM EST until February 25 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Essex County in New York, and Addison, Orange, Rutland, and Windsor Counties in Vermont. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Total liquid precipitation received in the past 24 hours has ranged from 0.5 to 1.0 inches. Combined with snowmelt, a few rivers gages may approach minor flood stage today. At this time, the location most likely to reach minor flood levels is Otter Creek at Center Rutland in Vermont. In the event of ice breakups, localized ice jam related flooding is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Orange; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Windsor
